title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs yet, emphasizing the need to improve current performance.
Despite a good postseason position, Red Sox face a slightly tougher remaining schedule compared to rivals like the Rangers.
Analytic models show the Red Sox have over a 90% chance of making the playoffs, despite recent challenges.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox CBO, is focused on hiring a general manager this offseason.
The Red Sox have not had a general manager since Breslow took over baseball operations in 2024.
Five assistant general managers, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the GM position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints in exchange for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
In addition to Polk, Patriots will send a 2028 seventh-round draft to the Saints.
Polk, a 2024 second-round pick, struggled with 12 receptions for 87 yards and 2 touchdowns last season.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to end a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami during Sunday's Week 2 matchup.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel faces pressure after a 33-8 loss to the Colts prompted a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa is 7-0 against the Patriots, averaging 231 passing yards and 1.57 touchdowns per game in those meetings.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on Sept. 12, presenting her Southern Gothic narrative in a concert setting.
The show featured songs from her albums 'Preacher’s Daughter' and 'Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You', enriching her fictional world.
The audience engaged intensely, with Ethel Cain merging performer and character in an immersive and emotional experience.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt, a college football player returning to the sport after 40 years.
Chiklis, 62, reunites with former Andover High teammates at a Boston screening of the film on September 14.
'The Senior,' directed by Rod Lurie, co-stars Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson, with a national release on September 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are among the Forbes 400 richest Americans, including Abigail Johnson and Robert Kraft.
Abigail Johnson, CEO of Fidelity Investments, is the richest in Massachusetts with a net worth of $35 billion.
Robert Kraft, owner of the New England Patriots, ranks as the 78th wealthiest American with $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lose to Yankees 4-1 in a sloppy series opener at Fenway Park.
Boston struggles offensively, managing only two hits and 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
Red Sox commit three errors, including a costly catcher's interference, aiding Yankees' win.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders DE Deatrich Wise Jr. sustained a season-ending left quad injury in a game against the Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured attempting to block an extra point and was carted off the field during Thursday Night Football.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders after eight seasons with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start Tuesday against the Athletics at Fenway Park, pending a final decision by Sunday.
Connelly Early impressed with 11 strikeouts over five scoreless innings in his Major League debut with the Red Sox.
Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora is considering rotation options, including young pitchers Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.
